<<<api>>>: JsonElement.getAsString
<<<code>>>: String conditions = forecastJson.getAsJsonObject().get("conditions").getAsString();
<<<explanation>>>: To get the value of "conditions" from the JSON, you can directly use the `getAsString()` method on the JsonElement representing the "conditions" field. In your code, replace the line `String conditions = String.valueOf(jp.parse(forecastJson.getAsJsonObject().get("conditions").getAsString()));` with `String conditions = forecastJson.getAsJsonObject().get("conditions").getAsString();`. This will retrieve the value of "conditions" as a String.
